title: Electron released near an electric dipole

content.question: An electron is released from rest at point <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following vectors indicates the direction of the electronâ€™s initial acceleration?

choices.label: The direction will be undefined, because the electron will remain at rest.
The figure presents a vector pointing to the left.
The figure presents a vector pointing to the right.
The figure presents a vector pointing upward.
The figure presents a vector pointing downward.

content.answer: The figure presents a vector pointing to the left.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
